page.title: 11PLANTS-PART 1
page.content: BREAN DOWN IS FAMOUS FOR SEVERAL RARE PLANTS.THE WHITE ROCK ROSE WITH ITS GREYISH LEAVES AND PURE WHITE THE FLOWER IS VERY ABUNDANT HERE,ALTHOUGH IT GROWS ONLY IN TWO OTHER SPOTS IN BRITAIN.THE INCONSICUOUS DWARF SEDGE IS ANOTHER RARITY-WHICH ISN'T OFTEN NOTICED AS IT FLOWERS IN MARCH. THE SHALLOW LIMESTONE SOIL SUPPORTS TYPICAL DOWN FLORA OF WILD THYME, SALAD BURNET,WOOD SAGE,ST.JOHNS WORT AND SCABIOUS.ON THE DEEPER SOILS THE TAIL BRACKEN FORN IS ABUNDANT-SPREADING WITH UNDERGROUND ROOTS IT IS FREE FROM DAMAGE BY FIRE.PRIVET GROWS WILD AS A LOW SHRUB BUT IT IS NOT AS ABUNDANT AS BRAMBLE WHICH IS SWAUPING GREAT AREAS OF THE NORTH SIDE.BLACKBERRIES IN AUTUMN PROVIDE FOOD FOR BIRDS AS WELL AS MAN.FEW TREES GROW EXCEPT HAWTHONE AND THE ODD ELDER ON ACCOUNT OF THE WIND AND SALT SPRAY.
